n view is that even though you ought to let the violinist use
your kidneys for the one hour he needs, we should not conclude that he
has a right to do so—we should say that if you refuse, you are, like [a] boy
who owns all the chocolates and will give none away, self-centered and
callous, indecent in fact, but not unjust. And similarly, that even suppos-
ing a case in which a woman pregnant due to rape ought to allow the un-
born person to use her body for the hour he needs, we should not conclu
